Interface Database

    public interface Database
extends Base
    Author:
    withersp OpenNTF Domino extensions to Database class

      void closeTransaction()
      Closes the transaction on a given database
      int compactWithOptions(java.util.Set<Database.CompactOption> options)
      The core lotus.domino.Database.compactWithOptions method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant options the developer wishes to apply.

      To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of org.openntf.domino.CompactOption objects.

      The core lotus.domino.Database#fixup(int) method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant options the developer wishes to apply.

      To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FixupOption objects.
      Document FTDomainSearch(java.lang.String query, int maxDocs, Database.FTDomainSortOption sortOpt, java.util.Set<Database.FTDomainSearchOption> otherOpt, int start, int count, java.lang.String entryForm)
      The core lotus.domino.Database.FTDomainSearch method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant search and sort options the developer wishes to apply.

      To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTDomainSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTDomainSortOption.

      The current database must be a Domain Catalog

      To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTSortOption.

      The current database must be a Domain Catalog

      To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTSortOption.

      The current database must be a Domain Catalog

      • generateEvent

        IDominoEvent generateEvent(EnumEvent event,
                           Base<?> source,
                           java.lang.Object payload)
        Generates an IDominoEvent into the IDominoEventFactory. The IDominoEvent will be for a specific EnumEvent, e.g. BEFORE_CREATE_DOCUMENT. This method basically triggers the EnumEvent, passing the relevant Objects that are currently being acted upon.

        EnumEvent types and contents can be found in Database.Events

        The target should not be passed into this method, but the implementation should pass this to as the target to org.openntf.domino.events.IDominoEventFactory.generate
        Parameters:
        event - EnumEvent being triggered, e.g. BEFORE_CREATE_DOCUMENT.
        source - The source object for the event to be run on. The relevant
        payload - Object a payload that can be passed along with the Event
        Returns:
        An IDominoEvent which will be passed to org.openntf.domino.ext.Base.fireListener
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 3.0.0

      • createMergableDocumentCollection

        DocumentCollection createMergableDocumentCollection()
        NOT YET FULLY IMPLEMENTED. If memory serves me correctly, there were problems creating a blank DocumentCollection and merging other documents into them. The core lotus.domino.DocumentCollection.merge does not work
        Returns:
        DocumentCollection ready to have Documents merged into it

      • getApiPath

        java.lang.String getApiPath()
        Some core XPages controls require a database path in format server!!filePath. This method will extract the relevant components and return that format.
        Returns:
        String in format server!!filePath, useful for XPages components
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 4.5.0

      • compactWithOptions

        int compactWithOptions(java.util.Set<Database.CompactOption> options)
        The core lotus.domino.Database.compactWithOptions method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant options the developer wishes to apply.

        To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of org.openntf.domino.CompactOption objects.
        Parameters:
        options - Set of compact options you wish to apply, e.g. CompactOption.COPYSTYLE
        Returns:
        int the difference in bytes between the size of the database before and after compacting
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0
        See Also:
        for options

      • compactWithOptions

        int compactWithOptions(java.util.Set<Database.CompactOption> options,
                       java.lang.String spaceThreshold)
        Parameters:
        options - Set of compact options you wish to apply, e.g. CompactOption.COPYSTYLE
        spaceThreshold - The value of the S option for a compact, but without the S. "10" for 10 percent, 10K for 10 kilobytes, 10M for 10 megabytes
        Returns:
        int the difference in bytes between the size of the database before and after compacting
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0
        See Also:
        for why overloaded methods for {@link lotus.domino.Database.compactWithOptions}, for options

        the newly created document

        void createFTIndex(java.util.Set<Database.FTIndexOption> options,
                   boolean recreate)
        The core lotus.domino.Database.createFTIndex method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant options the developer wishes to apply.

        To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTIndexOption objects.
        Parameters:
        options - Set full text index options that can be applied
        recreate - boolean whether or not the full text index should be recreated
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 2.5.0
        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Since:

        See Also:

      • FTDomainSearch

        Document FTDomainSearch(java.lang.String query,
                        int maxDocs,
                        Database.FTDomainSortOption sortOpt,
                        java.util.Set<Database.FTDomainSearchOption> otherOpt,
                        int start,
                        int count,
                        java.lang.String entryForm)
        The core lotus.domino.Database.FTDomainSearch method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant search and sort options the developer wishes to apply.

        To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTDomainSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTDomainSortOption.

        The current database must be a Domain Catalog
        Parameters:
        query - String the search query to use. Wildcards, operators, and other syntax are permitted. For the complete syntax rules, see "Refining a search query using operators" in Notes Help. Search for "query syntax" in the Domino Designer Eclipse help
        maxDocs - int the maximum number of documents to return. NOTE: the maximum will also be restricted by the setting on the server document, "Maximum search result limit" on the Internet Protocols..., Domino Web Engine tab
        sortOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSortOption options, e.g. date descending. If nothing is specified, relevance score will be the sorting option applied.
        otherOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSearchOption options, e.g. fuzzy search
        start - int the page from which to start showing
        count - int the count of pages to show
        entryForm - String the name of the Domain Search entry form in the domain catalog. This will be a traditional Domino web form, not an XPage form.
        Returns:
        Document with a rich text field called "Body" that contains a table of matching document titles
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 2.5.0
        See Also:
        Database.FTDomainSearchOption, Database.FTDomainSortOption

      • FTSearch

        DocumentCollection FTSearch(java.lang.String query,
                            int maxDocs,
                            Database.FTSortOption sortOpt,
                            java.util.Set<Database.FTSearchOption> otherOpt)
        The core lotus.domino.Database.FTSearch method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant search and sort options the developer wishes to apply.

        To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTSortOption.

        The current database must be a Domain Catalog
        Parameters:
        query - String the search query to use. Wildcards, operators, and other syntax are permitted. For the complete syntax rules, see "Refining a search query using operators" in Notes Help. Search for "query syntax" in the Domino Designer Eclipse help
        maxDocs - int the maximum number of documents to return. NOTE: the maximum will also be restricted by the setting on the server document, "Maximum search result limit" on the Internet Protocols..., Domino Web Engine tab
        sortOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSortOption options, e.g. date descending. If nothing is specified, relevance score will be the sorting option applied.
        otherOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSearchOption options, e.g. fuzzy search
        Returns:
        a DocumentCollection containing the documents matching the search criteria
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 2.5.0
        See Also:
        Database.FTSearchOption, Database.FTSortOption

      • FTSearchRange

        DocumentCollection FTSearchRange(java.lang.String query,
                                 int maxDocs,
                                 Database.FTSortOption sortOpt,
                                 java.util.Set<Database.FTSearchOption> otherOpt,
                                 int start)
        The core lotus.domino.Database.FTSearch method takes an int worked out by adding the integer value for all the relevant search and sort options the developer wishes to apply.

        To make code clearer and easier to support, this overloaded method has been added taking a Set of Database.FTSearchOption objects and a Set of Database.FTSortOption.

        The current database must be a Domain Catalog
        Parameters:
        query - String the search query to use. Wildcards, operators, and other syntax are permitted. For the complete syntax rules, see "Refining a search query using operators" in Notes Help. Search for "query syntax" in the Domino Designer Eclipse help
        maxDocs - int the maximum number of documents to return. NOTE: the maximum will also be restricted by the setting on the server document, "Maximum search result limit" on the Internet Protocols..., Domino Web Engine tab
        sortOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSortOption options, e.g. date descending. If nothing is specified, relevance score will be the sorting option applied.
        otherOpt - Set a Set of possible Database.FTDomainSearchOption options, e.g. fuzzy search
        start - the start number of the document in the collection from which to show
        Returns:
        a DocumentCollection of matching documents, starting at the number entered
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 2.5.0
        See Also:
        Database.FTSearchOption, Database.FTSortOption

      • getDesign

        DatabaseDesign getDesign()
        Gets a design.DatabaseDesign object providing access to various design elements of this database. The class also has helper methods to create some design resources, e.g. DatabaseDesign.createView()
        Returns:
        DatabaseDesign object
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getDocumentWithKey

        Document getDocumentWithKey(java.io.Serializable key)
        Retrieves a document by a String key.

        The key is hashed using MD5 and treated as a UNID.

        Parameters:
        key - The arbitrary-length string key.
        Returns:
        The Document corresponding to the key, or null if no matching document exists.
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getDocumentWithKey

        Document getDocumentWithKey(java.io.Serializable key,
                            boolean createOnFail)
        Retrieves a document by a String key, allowing for creation of a new document if no match was found.

        The key is hased using MD5 and treated as a UNID.

        Parameters:
        key - The arbitrary-length string key.
        createOnFail - Whether or not a new document should be created when the key was not found. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        The Document corresponding to the key, or null if no matching document exists and createOnFail is false.
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getModifiedDocuments

        DocumentCollection getModifiedDocuments(lotus.domino.DateTime since,
                                        Database.ModifiedDocClass noteClass)
        Gets any documents of a specific note type modified since a given date, using Database.ModifiedDocClass enum
        Parameters:
        since - DateTime after which documents should have been modified
        noteClass - ModifiedDocClass of notes to include in collection
        Returns:
        DocumentCollection of notes modified since the given date
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 2.5.0

      • sign

        void sign(Database.SignDocType documentType,
          boolean existingSigsOnly,
          java.lang.String name)
        Signs all notes corresponding to the Database.SignDocType, choosing whether to only update existing valid signatures
        Parameters:
        documentType - SignDocType note type to sign
        existingSigsOnly - boolean whether to update only existing signatures
        name - String the programmatic name or note id of a signle design element to update
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • sign

        void sign(Database.SignDocType documentType,
          boolean existingSigsOnly,
          java.lang.String name,
          boolean nameIsNoteid)
        Signs all notes corresponding to the Database.SignDocType, choosing whether to only update existing valid signatures
        Parameters:
        documentType - SignDocType note type to sign
        existingSigsOnly - boolean whether to update only existing signatures
        name - String the programmatic name or note id of a signle design element to update
        nameIsNoteid - boolean whether or not the name is a note id
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getDocumentMap

        Map
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 5.0.0
